intro: Cyrtosia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern cyrtosia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Cyrtosia septentrionalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
